dt-api.name: clear()
dt-api.summary: Clear the table of all data.

type.description: Simply remove all rows of data from the table.

dt-api.description:
This method simply removes all rows from the DataTables, resulting in a data length set of 0. New data might then be added using the `-api rows.add()` method.
Please be aware that this method will not automatically redraw the table with an empty data set. In order to redraw the table use the `-api draw()` method, which can be called simply as a chained method of the `-api clear()` method's returned object - for example `table.clear().draw();`. This is useful for performance when you would want to immediately add new rows to the table - you would only call the `-api draw()` method once all required rows have been added to help improve performance.
This method should not be used when `-init serverSide` is enabled. When server-side processing is enabled, the data should be deleted from the data store (i.e. an Ajax request to the server) and then `-api draw()` called. Deleting the client-side data will have no effect when server-side processing is enabled since the data would simply be restored on the next draw if the data is not removed from the server.
